title: Britain's Got Talent magician Richard Jones wows with baffling card trick
text:

Fresh from his Britain's Got Talent: The Champions stint, magician Richard Jones has revealed a baffling card trick.

The former solider, 29, made the jack of hearts transform into the eight of diamonds before our very eyes.

It started when he asked a Mirror Online reporter to pick a card from the deck and asked her to write her name on it.

She placed it back in the pile and then he went through the pack, before one card changed colour from red to blue.

The new card was the eight of diamonds, the one she'd originally chosen from the pack.

(Image: ITV)

Next he put the card in another reporter's hand and shuffled the ones he had left, choosing the jack of hearts.

Then he shuffled again and threw the cards up in the air, from hand to the other.

The jack of hearts then appeared from the pack.

(Image: Splash News)

He then shook the card and it transformed back again into the eight of diamonds.

Richard took part in BGT: The Champions but was eliminated in week three.

Despite his early exit, he was thrilled with the reaction he got from the audience.

(Image: ITV)

Richard said: "I've never experienced anything like it, walking out to Wembley Arena to thousands of people all going absolutely wild. It was an experience I'll never forget, I loved every second of it.

"I didn't feel like there was any pressure at all being there which is why I enjoyed it so much, which is why it was such a memorable thing because I wasn't going there to win.

"I just wanted to get there and perform in Wembley Arena and be back on BGT. In all honesty the reaction I got from the crowd was so nice and so lovely it far exceeded my expectations."
description: EXCLUSIVE: The former solider, 29, made the jack of hearts transform into the eight of diamonds before our very eyes
